subject: Leadership
title: Moral Reasoning Models
description: Learn Moral Reasoning Models in one minute.

hook.text: When the right choice isn't clear, you need a process. Gut feelings aren't reliable under pressure.

buildup.text: Rest's model has four parts: moral sensitivity, judgment, motivation, and character. All must align for ethical action.

discovery.text: Most ethical failures happen at the sensitivity stage. People don't see the moral issue until it's too late.

twist.text: Good judgment means nothing without motivation. Leaders who see the right thing but lack courage don't act on it.

climax.text: Train all four stages. Discuss dilemmas regularly. Build moral sensitivity through practice, not just policy manuals.

punchline.text: Seeing the right thing is step one. Doing it is four steps.

quiz.question: Where do most ethical failures occur in Rest's model?
options: At the sensitivity stage when people miss the moral issue
